definition: to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: And it would be foolish to bet against the People's Bank.
sentences.chinese: 而和人民銀行作對就是犯傻。

sentences.english: February 2 is the day for a classic bit of American silliness.
sentences.chinese: 2月2日是美國人犯傻的經典之作上演的日子。

sentences.english: “Don't be an idiot,” he said. “This is a rocket ship.
sentences.chinese: “別犯傻了，”他說，“這是一艘火箭飛船。

sentences.english: But sometimes I just don't feel silly.
sentences.chinese: 但是有的時候我不想犯傻。

sentences.english: And here in India, we only have stupid Bollywood.
sentences.chinese: 印度只有看了會讓人犯傻的寶萊塢電影拿得出手。

sentences.english: Oh how I regret the times I chastised you.
sentences.chinese: 我後悔當初對你教育的犯傻。

sentences.english: “Don't be an idiot,” he said.“This is a rocket ship.
sentences.chinese: “別犯傻了，”他說，“這是一艘火箭飛船。

sentences.english: This almost everyone in be silly.
sentences.chinese: 這一點幾乎大家都在犯傻。

sentences.english: LL: Wacky means crazy or silly.
sentences.chinese: Wacky就是指瘋瘋顛顛或犯傻。

sentences.english: The third time is just me being goofy.
sentences.chinese: 第三遍時，就變成我自己在這犯傻了。

sentences.english: Don't be absurd—you're just worrying about nothing.
sentences.chinese: 別犯傻了，你不過是在瞎操心。

definition: to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
erhua variant of 缺心眼[que1 xin1 yan3]
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
